actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on January 25, 2023.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mrs. Fischbach moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
On approving the Journal Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 425
actions-list.actionItem: 0 (Roll no. 33).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 300 — "To amend chapter 3 of title 5, United States Code, to require the publication of settlement agreements, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 422
actions-list.actionItem: 2 (Roll no. 32).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 159 — "To implement merit-based reforms to the civil service hiring system that replace degree-based hiring with skills- and competency-based hiring, and for other purposes."

The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on motions to suspend the rules and pass H.R. 159, as amended, H.R. 300, as amended and agreeing to the Speaker's Approval of the Journal, if ordered, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of January 24.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for approximately 6:30 p.m. today.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 300.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Comer moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 300 — "To amend chapter 3 of title 5, United States Code, to require the publication of settlement agreements, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 159.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Comer moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 159 — "To implement merit-based reforms to the civil service hiring system that replace degree-based hiring with skills- and competency-based hiring, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of January 24.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Wilson of SC to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.

The Chair announced that he had examined the Journal of the last day's proceedings and had approved it. Mr. Wilson (SC) demanded that the question be put on agreeing to the Speaker's approval of the Journal and by voice vote, the Chair announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Wilson (SC) objected to the voice vote based upon the absence of a quorum and the Chair postponed further proceedings on the question of agreeing to the Speaker's approval of the Journal until a time to be announced.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of January 24.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for approximately 2:00 p.m. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Matthew M. Rosendale Sr. to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
